intro: Cereus greggii var. roseiflorus, commonly known as the Rose-flowered Cactus, is a unique variant of the Gregg's Cereus. It is native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. This plant is characterized by its tall, columnar stem and striking pink to red flowers that bloom at night. The flowers are typically borne on the upper part of the stem and are highly fragrant. It has a slow growth rate and requires well-draining soil and minimal water to thrive.
